39 namespace convert_fn_ptr_to_sandbox_equivalent_detail {
40  template<typename T, typename T_Sbx>
41  using conv = ::rlbox::detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T, T_Sbx>;
42 
43  template<typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
44  using T_Func = T_Ret (*)(T_Args...);
45 
46  template<typename T_Sbx, typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
47  T_Func<conv<T_Ret, T_Sbx>, conv<T_Args, T_Sbx>...> helper(
48  T_Ret (*)(T_Args...));
49 }

51 #if defined(RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES) || \
52  defined(RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_OUT) || defined(RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_IN)
53 enum class rlbox_transition
54 {
55  INVOKE,
56  CALLBACK
57 };
58 #endif
59 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
60 struct rlbox_transition_timing
61 {
62  rlbox_transition invoke;
63  const char* name;
64  void* ptr;
65  int64_t time;
66 
67  std::string to_string()
68  {
69  std::ostringstream ret;
70  if (invoke == rlbox_transition::INVOKE) {
71  ret << name;
72  } else {
73  ret << "Callback " << ptr;
74  }
75  ret << " : " << time << "\n";
76 
77  return ret.str();
78  }
79 };
80 #endif
81 
82 #ifndef RLBOX_SINGLE_THREADED_INVOCATIONS
83 # error \
84  "RLBox does not yet support threading. Please define RLBOX_SINGLE_THREADED_INVOCATIONS prior to including RLBox and ensure you are only using it from a single thread. If threading is required, please file a bug."
85 #endif
86 
93 template<typename T_Sbx>
94 class rlbox_sandbox : protected T_Sbx
95 {
96  KEEP_CLASSES_FRIENDLY
97 
98 private:
99 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
100  std::vector<rlbox_transition_timing> transition_times;
101 #endif
102 
103  static inline RLBOX_SHARED_LOCK(sandbox_list_lock);
104  // The actual type of the vector is std::vector<rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>*>
105  // However clang 5, 6 have bugs where compilation seg-faults on this type
106  // So we just use this std::vector<void*>
107  static inline std::vector<void*> sandbox_list;
108 
109  RLBOX_SHARED_LOCK(func_ptr_cache_lock);
110  std::map<std::string, void*> func_ptr_map;
111 
112  app_pointer_map<typename T_Sbx::T_PointerType> app_ptr_map;
113 
114  // This variable tracks of the sandbox has already been created/destroyed.
115  // APIs in this class should be called only when the sandbox is created.
116  // However, it is expensive to check in APIs such as invoke or in the callback
117  // interceptor. What's more, there could be time of check time of use issues
118  // in the checks as well.
119  // In general, we leave it up to the user to ensure these APIs are never
120  // called prior to sandbox construction or after destruction. We perform some
121  // conservative sanity checks, where they would not add too much overhead.
122  enum class Sandbox_Status
123  {
124  NOT_CREATED,
125  INITIALIZING,
126  CREATED,
127  CLEANING_UP
128  };
129  std::atomic<Sandbox_Status> sandbox_created = Sandbox_Status::NOT_CREATED;
130 
131  std::mutex callback_lock;
132  std::vector<void*> callback_keys;
133 
134  void* transition_state = nullptr;
135 
136  template<typename T>
137  using convert_fn_ptr_to_sandbox_equivalent_t =
138  decltype(::rlbox::convert_fn_ptr_to_sandbox_equivalent_detail::helper<
139  T_Sbx>(std::declval<T>()));
140 
141  template<typename T>
142  inline constexpr void check_invoke_param_type_is_ok()
143  {
144  using T_NoRef = std::remove_reference_t<T>;
145 
146  if_constexpr_named(cond1, detail::rlbox_is_wrapper_v<T_NoRef>)
147  {
148  if_constexpr_named(
149  subcond1,
150  !std::is_same_v<T_Sbx, detail::rlbox_get_wrapper_sandbox_t<T_NoRef>>)
151  {
152  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
153  cond1 && subcond1,
154  "Mixing tainted data from a different sandbox types. This could "
155  "happen due to couple of different reasons.\n"
156  "1. You are using 2 sandbox types for example'rlbox_noop_sandbox' "
157  "and 'rlbox_lucet_sandbox', and are passing tainted data from one "
158  "sandbox as parameters into a function call to the other sandbox. "
159  "This is not allowed, unwrap the tainted data with copy_and_verify "
160  "or other unwrapping APIs first.\n"
161  "2. You have inadvertantly forgotten to set/remove "
162  "RLBOX_USE_STATIC_CALLS depending on the sandbox type. Some sandbox "
163  "types like rlbox_noop_sandbox require this to be set to a given "
164  "value, while other types like rlbox_lucet_sandbox, require this not "
165  "to be set.");
166  }
167  }
168  else if_constexpr_named(cond2,
169  std::is_null_pointer_v<T_NoRef> ||
170  detail::is_fundamental_or_enum_v<T_NoRef>)
171  {}
172  else
173  {
174  constexpr auto unknownCase = !(cond1 || cond2);
175  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
176  unknownCase,
177  "Arguments to a sandbox function call should be primitives or wrapped "
178  "types like tainted, callbacks etc.");
179  }
180  }
181 
182  template<typename T>
183  inline auto invoke_process_param(T&& param)
184  {
185  check_invoke_param_type_is_ok<T>();
186 
187  using T_NoRef = std::remove_reference_t<T>;
188 
189  if constexpr (detail::rlbox_is_tainted_opaque_v<T_NoRef>) {
190  auto ret = from_opaque(param);
191  return ret.UNSAFE_sandboxed(*this);
192  } else if constexpr (detail::rlbox_is_wrapper_v<T_NoRef>) {
193  return param.UNSAFE_sandboxed(*this);
194  } else if constexpr (std::is_null_pointer_v<T_NoRef>) {
195  tainted<void*, T_Sbx> ret = nullptr;
196  return ret.UNSAFE_sandboxed(*this);
197  } else if constexpr (detail::is_fundamental_or_enum_v<T_NoRef>) {
198  // For unwrapped primitives, assign to a tainted var and then unwrap so
199  // that we adjust for machine model
200  tainted<T_NoRef, T_Sbx> ret = param;
201  return ret.UNSAFE_sandboxed(*this);
202  } else {
203  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(detail::true_v<T_NoRef>, "Unknown case");
204  }
205  }
206 
207  template<typename T, typename T_Arg>
208  inline tainted<T, T_Sbx> sandbox_callback_intercept_convert_param(
209  rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox,
210  const T_Arg& arg)
211  {
212  tainted<T, T_Sbx> ret;
213  using namespace detail;
214  convert_type<T_Sbx,
215  adjust_type_direction::TO_APPLICATION,
216  adjust_type_context::SANDBOX>(
217  ret.get_raw_value_ref(),
218  arg,
219  nullptr /* example_unsandboxed_ptr */,
220  &sandbox);
221  return ret;
222  }
223 
224  template<typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
225  static detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T_Ret, T_Sbx>
226  sandbox_callback_interceptor(
227  detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T_Args, T_Sbx>... args)
228  {
229  std::pair<T_Sbx*, void*> context =
230  T_Sbx::impl_get_executed_callback_sandbox_and_key();
231  auto& sandbox = *(reinterpret_cast<rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>*>(context.first));
232  auto key = context.second;
233 
234  using T_Func_Ret =
235  std::conditional_t<std::is_void_v<T_Ret>, void, tainted<T_Ret, T_Sbx>>;
236  using T_Func =
237  T_Func_Ret (*)(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>&, tainted<T_Args, T_Sbx>...);
238  auto target_fn_ptr = reinterpret_cast<T_Func>(key);
239 
240 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
241  high_resolution_clock::time_point enter_time = high_resolution_clock::now();
242  auto on_exit = rlbox::detail::make_scope_exit([&] {
243  auto exit_time = high_resolution_clock::now();
244  int64_t ns = duration_cast<nanoseconds>(exit_time - enter_time).count();
245  sandbox.transition_times.push_back(
246  rlbox_transition_timing{ rlbox_transition::CALLBACK,
247  nullptr /* func_name */,
248  key /* func_ptr */,
249  ns });
250  });
251 #endif
252 #ifdef RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_OUT
253  RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_OUT(rlbox_transition::CALLBACK,
254  nullptr /* func_name */,
255  key /* func_ptr */,
256  sandbox.transition_state);
257 #endif
258 #ifdef RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_IN
259  auto on_exit_transition = rlbox::detail::make_scope_exit([&] {
260  RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_IN(rlbox_transition::CALLBACK,
261  nullptr /* func_name */,
262  key /* func_ptr */,
263  sandbox.transition_state);
264  });
265 #endif
266  if constexpr (std::is_void_v<T_Func_Ret>) {
267  (*target_fn_ptr)(
268  sandbox,
269  sandbox.template sandbox_callback_intercept_convert_param<T_Args>(
270  sandbox, args)...);
271  return;
272  } else {
273  auto tainted_ret = (*target_fn_ptr)(
274  sandbox,
275  sandbox.template sandbox_callback_intercept_convert_param<T_Args>(
276  sandbox, args)...);
277 
278  using namespace detail;
279  convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T_Ret, T_Sbx> ret;
280  convert_type<T_Sbx,
281  adjust_type_direction::TO_SANDBOX,
282  adjust_type_context::SANDBOX>(
283  ret,
284  tainted_ret.get_raw_value_ref(),
285  nullptr /* example_unsandboxed_ptr */,
286  &sandbox);
287  return ret;
288  }
289  }
290 
295  template<typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
296  inline void unregister_callback(void* key)
297  {
298  // Silently swallowing the failure is better here as RAII types may try to
299  // cleanup callbacks after sandbox destruction
300  if (sandbox_created.load() != Sandbox_Status::CREATED) {
301  return;
302  }
303 
304  this->template impl_unregister_callback<
305  detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T_Ret, T_Sbx>,
306  detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T_Args, T_Sbx>...>(key);
307 
308  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(callback_lock);
309  auto el_ref = std::find(callback_keys.begin(), callback_keys.end(), key);
310  detail::dynamic_check(
311  el_ref != callback_keys.end(),
312  "Unexpected state. Unregistering a callback that was never registered.");
313  callback_keys.erase(el_ref);
314  }
315 
316  static T_Sbx* find_sandbox_from_example(const void* example_sandbox_ptr)
317  {
318  detail::dynamic_check(
319  example_sandbox_ptr != nullptr,
320  "Internal error: received a null example pointer. Please file a bug.");
321 
322  RLBOX_ACQUIRE_SHARED_GUARD(lock, sandbox_list_lock);
323  for (auto sandbox_v : sandbox_list) {
324  auto sandbox = reinterpret_cast<rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>*>(sandbox_v);
325  if (sandbox->is_pointer_in_sandbox_memory(example_sandbox_ptr)) {
326  return sandbox;
327  }
328  }
329 
330  detail::dynamic_check(
331  false,
332  "Internal error: Could not find the sandbox associated with example "
333  "pointer. Please file a bug.");
334  return nullptr;
335  }
336 
337 public:
343  void* sandbox_storage;
344 
345  /***** Function to adjust for custom machine models *****/
346 
347  template<typename T>
348  using convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t =
349  detail::convert_base_types_t<T,
350  typename T_Sbx::T_ShortType,
351  typename T_Sbx::T_IntType,
352  typename T_Sbx::T_LongType,
353  typename T_Sbx::T_LongLongType,
354  typename T_Sbx::T_PointerType>;
355 
356  T_Sbx* get_sandbox_impl() { return this; }
357 
364  template<typename... T_Args>
365  inline auto create_sandbox(T_Args... args)
366  {
367 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
368  // Warm up the timer. The first call is always slow (at least on the test
369  // platform)
370  for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
371  auto val = high_resolution_clock::now();
372  RLBOX_UNUSED(val);
373  }
374 #endif
375  auto expected = Sandbox_Status::NOT_CREATED;
376  bool success = sandbox_created.compare_exchange_strong(
377  expected, Sandbox_Status::INITIALIZING /* desired */);
378  detail::dynamic_check(
379  success,
380  "create_sandbox called when sandbox already created/is being "
381  "created concurrently");
382 
383  return detail::return_first_result(
384  [&]() {
385  return this->impl_create_sandbox(std::forward<T_Args>(args)...);
386  },
387  [&]() {
388  sandbox_created.store(Sandbox_Status::CREATED);
389  RLBOX_ACQUIRE_UNIQUE_GUARD(lock, sandbox_list_lock);
390  sandbox_list.push_back(this);
391  });
392  }
393 
397  inline auto destroy_sandbox()
398  {
399  auto expected = Sandbox_Status::CREATED;
400  bool success = sandbox_created.compare_exchange_strong(
401  expected, Sandbox_Status::CLEANING_UP /* desired */);
402 
403  detail::dynamic_check(
404  success,
405  "destroy_sandbox called without sandbox creation/is being "
406  "destroyed concurrently");
407 
408  {
409  RLBOX_ACQUIRE_UNIQUE_GUARD(lock, sandbox_list_lock);
410  auto el_ref = std::find(sandbox_list.begin(), sandbox_list.end(), this);
411  detail::dynamic_check(
412  el_ref != sandbox_list.end(),
413  "Unexpected state. Destroying a sandbox that was never initialized.");
414  sandbox_list.erase(el_ref);
415  }
416 
417  sandbox_created.store(Sandbox_Status::NOT_CREATED);
418  return this->impl_destroy_sandbox();
419  }
420 
421  template<typename T>
422  inline T get_unsandboxed_pointer(
423  convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t<T> p) const
424  {
425  static_assert(std::is_pointer_v<T>);
426  if (p == 0) {
427  return nullptr;
428  }
429  auto ret = this->template impl_get_unsandboxed_pointer<T>(p);
430  return reinterpret_cast<T>(ret);
431  }
432 
433  template<typename T>
434  inline convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t<T> get_sandboxed_pointer(
435  const void* p) const
436  {
437  static_assert(std::is_pointer_v<T>);
438  if (p == nullptr) {
439  return 0;
440  }
441  return this->template impl_get_sandboxed_pointer<T>(p);
442  }
443 
444  template<typename T>
445  static inline T get_unsandboxed_pointer_no_ctx(
446  convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t<T> p,
447  const void* example_unsandboxed_ptr)
448  {
449  static_assert(std::is_pointer_v<T>);
450  if (p == 0) {
451  return nullptr;
452  }
453  auto ret = T_Sbx::template impl_get_unsandboxed_pointer_no_ctx<T>(
454  p, example_unsandboxed_ptr, find_sandbox_from_example);
455  return reinterpret_cast<T>(ret);
456  }
457 
458  template<typename T>
459  static inline convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t<T>
460  get_sandboxed_pointer_no_ctx(const void* p,
461  const void* example_unsandboxed_ptr)
462  {
463  static_assert(std::is_pointer_v<T>);
464  if (p == nullptr) {
465  return 0;
466  }
467  return T_Sbx::template impl_get_sandboxed_pointer_no_ctx<T>(
468  p, example_unsandboxed_ptr, find_sandbox_from_example);
469  }
470 
481  template<typename T>
482  inline tainted<T*, T_Sbx> malloc_in_sandbox()
483  {
484  const uint32_t defaultCount = 1;
485  return malloc_in_sandbox<T>(defaultCount);
486  }
487 
500  template<typename T>
501  inline tainted<T*, T_Sbx> malloc_in_sandbox(uint32_t count)
502  {
503  // Silently swallowing the failure is better here as RAII types may try to
504  // malloc after sandbox destruction
505  if (sandbox_created.load() != Sandbox_Status::CREATED) {
506  return tainted<T*, T_Sbx>::internal_factory(nullptr);
507  }
508 
509  detail::dynamic_check(count != 0, "Malloc tried to allocate 0 bytes");
510  if constexpr (sizeof(T) >= std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max()) {
511  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(sizeof(T) >=
512  std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max(),
513  "Tried to allocate an object over 4GB.");
514  }
515  auto total_size = static_cast<uint64_t>(sizeof(T)) * count;
516  if constexpr (sizeof(size_t) == 4) {
517  // On a 32-bit platform, we need to make sure that total_size is not >=4GB
518  detail::dynamic_check(total_size < std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max(),
519  "Tried to allocate memory over 4GB");
520  } else if constexpr (sizeof(size_t) != 8) {
521  // Double check we are on a 64-bit platform
522  // Note for static checks we need to have some dependence on T, so adding
523  // a dummy
524  constexpr bool dummy = sizeof(T) >= 0;
525  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(dummy && sizeof(size_t) != 8,
526  "Expected 32 or 64 bit platform.");
527  }
528  auto ptr_in_sandbox = this->impl_malloc_in_sandbox(total_size);
529  auto ptr = get_unsandboxed_pointer<T*>(ptr_in_sandbox);
530  if (!ptr) {
531  return tainted<T*, T_Sbx>(nullptr);
532  }
533  detail::dynamic_check(is_pointer_in_sandbox_memory(ptr),
534  "Malloc returned pointer outside the sandbox memory");
535  auto ptr_end = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(ptr + (count - 1));
536  detail::dynamic_check(
537  is_in_same_sandbox(ptr, reinterpret_cast<void*>(ptr_end)),
538  "Malloc returned a pointer whose range goes beyond sandbox memory");
539  auto cast_ptr = reinterpret_cast<T*>(ptr);
540  return tainted<T*, T_Sbx>::internal_factory(cast_ptr);
541  }
542 
548  template<typename T>
549  inline void free_in_sandbox(tainted<T*, T_Sbx> ptr)
550  {
551  // Silently swallowing the failure is better here as RAII types may try to
552  // free after sandbox destruction
553  if (sandbox_created.load() != Sandbox_Status::CREATED) {
554  return;
555  }
556 
557  this->impl_free_in_sandbox(ptr.get_raw_sandbox_value(*this));
558  }
559 
565  template<typename T>
566  inline void free_in_sandbox(tainted_volatile<T, T_Sbx>& ptr_ref)
567  {
568  tainted<T, T_Sbx> ptr = ptr_ref;
569  free_in_sandbox(ptr);
570  }
571 
577  template<typename T>
578  inline void free_in_sandbox(tainted_opaque<T, T_Sbx> ptr_opaque)
579  {
580  tainted<T, T_Sbx> ptr = from_opaque(ptr_opaque);
581  free_in_sandbox(ptr);
582  }

589  {
590  return T_Sbx::impl_is_in_same_sandbox(p1, p2);

597  inline bool is_pointer_in_sandbox_memory(const void* p)
598  {
599  return this->impl_is_pointer_in_sandbox_memory(p);

631  template<typename T>
632  inline tainted<T*, T_Sbx> INTERNAL_grant_access(T* src,
633  size_t num,
634  bool& success)
635  {
636  auto ret = this->impl_grant_access(src, num, success);
637  return tainted<T*, T_Sbx>::internal_factory(ret);
638  }
639 
649  template<typename T>
650  inline T* INTERNAL_deny_access(tainted<T*, T_Sbx> src,
651  size_t num,
652  bool& success)
653  {
654  auto ret =
655  this->impl_deny_access(src.INTERNAL_unverified_safe(), num, success);
656  return ret;
657  }
658 
659  void* lookup_symbol(const char* func_name)
660  {
661  {
662  RLBOX_ACQUIRE_SHARED_GUARD(lock, func_ptr_cache_lock);
663 
664  auto func_ptr_ref = func_ptr_map.find(func_name);
665  if (func_ptr_ref != func_ptr_map.end()) {
666  return func_ptr_ref->second;
667  }
668  }
669 
670  void* func_ptr = this->impl_lookup_symbol(func_name);
671  RLBOX_ACQUIRE_UNIQUE_GUARD(lock, func_ptr_cache_lock);
672  func_ptr_map[func_name] = func_ptr;
673  return func_ptr;
674  }
675 
676  // this is an internal function invoked from macros, so it has be public
677  template<typename T, typename... T_Args>
678  inline auto INTERNAL_invoke_with_func_name(const char* func_name,
679  T_Args&&... params)
680  {
681  return INTERNAL_invoke_with_func_ptr<T, T_Args...>(
682  func_name, lookup_symbol(func_name), std::forward<T_Args>(params)...);
683  }
684 
685  // this is an internal function invoked from macros, so it has be public
686  // Explicitly don't use inline on this, as this adds a lot of instructions
687  // prior to function call. What's more, by not inlining, different function
688  // calls with the same signature can share the same code segments for
689  // sandboxed function execution in the binary
690  template<typename T, typename... T_Args>
691  auto INTERNAL_invoke_with_func_ptr(const char* func_name,
692  void* func_ptr,
693  T_Args&&... params)
694  {
695  // unused in some paths
696  RLBOX_UNUSED(func_name);
697 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
698  auto enter_time = high_resolution_clock::now();
699  auto on_exit = rlbox::detail::make_scope_exit([&] {
700  auto exit_time = high_resolution_clock::now();
701  int64_t ns = duration_cast<nanoseconds>(exit_time - enter_time).count();
702  transition_times.push_back(rlbox_transition_timing{
703  rlbox_transition::INVOKE, func_name, func_ptr, ns });
704  });
705 #endif
706 #ifdef RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_IN
707  RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_IN(
708  rlbox_transition::INVOKE, func_name, func_ptr, transition_state);
709 #endif
710 #ifdef RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_OUT
711  auto on_exit_transition = rlbox::detail::make_scope_exit([&] {
712  RLBOX_TRANSITION_ACTION_OUT(
713  rlbox_transition::INVOKE, func_name, func_ptr, transition_state);
714  });
715 #endif
716  (check_invoke_param_type_is_ok<T_Args>(), ...);
717 
718  static_assert(
719  rlbox::detail::polyfill::is_invocable_v<
720  T,
721  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<std::remove_reference_t<T_Args>>...>,
722  "Mismatched arguments types for function");
723 
724  using T_Result = rlbox::detail::polyfill::invoke_result_t<
725  T,
726  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<std::remove_reference_t<T_Args>>...>;
727 
728  using T_Converted =
729  std::remove_pointer_t<convert_fn_ptr_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<T*>>;
730 
731  if constexpr (std::is_void_v<T_Result>) {
732  this->template impl_invoke_with_func_ptr<T>(
733  reinterpret_cast<T_Converted*>(func_ptr),
734  invoke_process_param(params)...);
735  return;
736  } else {
737  auto raw_result = this->template impl_invoke_with_func_ptr<T>(
738  reinterpret_cast<T_Converted*>(func_ptr),
739  invoke_process_param(params)...);
740  tainted<T_Result, T_Sbx> wrapped_result;
741  using namespace detail;
742  convert_type<T_Sbx,
743  adjust_type_direction::TO_APPLICATION,
744  adjust_type_context::SANDBOX>(
745  wrapped_result.get_raw_value_ref(),
746  raw_result,
747  nullptr /* example_unsandboxed_ptr */,
748  this /* sandbox_ptr */);
749  return wrapped_result;
750  }
751  }
752 
753  // Useful in the porting stage to temporarily allow non tainted pointers to go
754  // through. This will only ever work in the rlbox_noop_sandbox. Any sandbox
755  // that actually enforces isolation will crash here.
756  template<typename T2>
757  tainted<T2, T_Sbx> UNSAFE_accept_pointer(T2 ptr)
758  {
759  static_assert(std::is_pointer_v<T2>,
760  "UNSAFE_accept_pointer expects a pointer param");
761  tainted<T2, T_Sbx> ret;
762  ret.assign_raw_pointer(*this, ptr);
763  return ret;
764  }
765 
766  template<typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
767  using T_Cb_no_wrap = detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Ret>(
768  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Args>...);
769 
770  template<typename T_Ret>
771  sandbox_callback<T_Cb_no_wrap<T_Ret>*, T_Sbx> register_callback(T_Ret (*)())
772  {
773  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
774  detail::true_v<T_Ret>,
775  "Modify the callback to change the first parameter to a sandbox."
776  "For instance if a callback has type\n\n"
777  "int foo() {...}\n\n"
778  "Change this to \n\n"
779  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> foo(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox) {...}\n");
780 
781  // this is never executed, but we need it for the function to type-check
782  std::abort();
783  }
784 
797  template<typename T_RL, typename T_Ret, typename... T_Args>
798  sandbox_callback<T_Cb_no_wrap<T_Ret, T_Args...>*, T_Sbx> register_callback(
799  T_Ret (*func_ptr)(T_RL, T_Args...))
800  {
801  // Some branches don't use the param
802  RLBOX_UNUSED(func_ptr);
803 
804  if_constexpr_named(cond1, !std::is_same_v<T_RL, rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>&>)
805  {
806  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
807  cond1,
808  "Modify the callback to change the first parameter to a sandbox."
809  "For instance if a callback has type\n\n"
810  "int foo(int a, int b) {...}\n\n"
811  "Change this to \n\n"
812  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> foo(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox,"
813  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> a, tainted<int, T_Sbx> b) {...}\n");
814  }
815  else if_constexpr_named(
816  cond2, !(detail::rlbox_is_tainted_or_opaque_v<T_Args> && ...))
817  {
818  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
819  cond2,
820  "Change all arguments to the callback have to be tainted or "
821  "tainted_opaque."
822  "For instance if a callback has type\n\n"
823  "int foo(int a, int b) {...}\n\n"
824  "Change this to \n\n"
825  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> foo(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox,"
826  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> a, tainted<int, T_Sbx> b) {...}\n");
827  }
828  else if_constexpr_named(
829  cond3, (std::is_array_v<detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Args>> || ...))
830  {
831  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
832  cond3,
833  "Change all static array arguments to the callback to be pointers."
834  "For instance if a callback has type\n\n"
835  "int foo(int a[4]) {...}\n\n"
836  "Change this to \n\n"
837  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> foo(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox,"
838  "tainted<int*, T_Sbx> a) {...}\n");
839  }
840  else if_constexpr_named(
841  cond4,
842  !(std::is_void_v<T_Ret> || detail::rlbox_is_tainted_or_opaque_v<T_Ret>))
843  {
844  rlbox_detail_static_fail_because(
845  cond4,
846  "Change the callback return type to be tainted or tainted_opaque if it "
847  "is not void."
848  "For instance if a callback has type\n\n"
849  "int foo(int a, int b) {...}\n\n"
850  "Change this to \n\n"
851  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> foo(rlbox_sandbox<T_Sbx>& sandbox,"
852  "tainted<int, T_Sbx> a, tainted<int, T_Sbx> b) {...}\n");
853  }
854  else
855  {
856  detail::dynamic_check(
857  sandbox_created.load() == Sandbox_Status::CREATED,
858  "register_callback called without sandbox creation");
859 
860  // Need unique key for each callback we register - just use the func addr
861  void* unique_key = reinterpret_cast<void*>(func_ptr);
862 
863  // Make sure that the user hasn't previously registered this function...
864  // If they have, we would returning 2 owning types (sandbox_callback) to
865  // the same callback which would be bad
866  {
867  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(callback_lock);
868  bool exists =
869  std::find(callback_keys.begin(), callback_keys.end(), unique_key) !=
870  callback_keys.end();
871  detail::dynamic_check(
872  !exists, "You have previously already registered this callback.");
873  callback_keys.push_back(unique_key);
874  }
875 
876  auto callback_interceptor =
877  sandbox_callback_interceptor<detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Ret>,
878  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Args>...>;
879 
880  auto callback_trampoline = this->template impl_register_callback<
881  detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<
882  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Ret>,
883  T_Sbx>,
884  detail::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_t<
885  detail::rlbox_remove_wrapper_t<T_Args>,
886  T_Sbx>...>(unique_key, reinterpret_cast<void*>(callback_interceptor));
887 
888  auto tainted_func_ptr = reinterpret_cast<
889  detail::rlbox_tainted_opaque_to_tainted_t<T_Ret, T_Sbx> (*)(
890  T_RL, detail::rlbox_tainted_opaque_to_tainted_t<T_Args, T_Sbx>...)>(
891  reinterpret_cast<void*>(func_ptr));
892 
893  auto ret = sandbox_callback<T_Cb_no_wrap<T_Ret, T_Args...>*, T_Sbx>(
894  this,
895  tainted_func_ptr,
896  callback_interceptor,
897  callback_trampoline,
898  unique_key);
899  return ret;
900  }
901  }
902 
903  // this is an internal function invoked from macros, so it has be public
904  template<typename T>
905  inline tainted<T*, T_Sbx> INTERNAL_get_sandbox_function_name(
906  const char* func_name)
907  {
908  return INTERNAL_get_sandbox_function_ptr<T>(lookup_symbol(func_name));
909  }
910 
911  // this is an internal function invoked from macros, so it has be public
912  template<typename T>
913  inline tainted<T*, T_Sbx> INTERNAL_get_sandbox_function_ptr(void* func_ptr)
914  {
915  return tainted<T*, T_Sbx>::internal_factory(reinterpret_cast<T*>(func_ptr));
916  }
917 
926  template<typename T>
927  app_pointer<T*, T_Sbx> get_app_pointer(T* ptr)
928  {
929  auto idx = app_ptr_map.get_app_pointer_idx((void*)ptr);
930  auto idx_as_ptr = this->template impl_get_unsandboxed_pointer<T>(idx);
931  // Right now we simply assume that any integer can be converted to a valid
932  // pointer in the sandbox This may not be true for some sandboxing mechanism
933  // plugins in the future In this case, we will have to come up with
934  // something more clever to construct indexes that look like valid pointers
935  // Add a check for now to make sure things work fine
936  detail::dynamic_check(is_pointer_in_sandbox_memory(idx_as_ptr),
937  "App pointers are not currently supported for this "
938  "rlbox sandbox plugin. Please file a bug.");
939  auto ret = app_pointer<T*, T_Sbx>(
940  &app_ptr_map, idx, reinterpret_cast<T*>(idx_as_ptr));
941  return ret;
942  }
943 
952  template<typename T>
953  T* lookup_app_ptr(tainted<T*, T_Sbx> tainted_ptr)
954  {
955  auto idx = tainted_ptr.get_raw_sandbox_value(*this);
956  void* ret = app_ptr_map.lookup_index(idx);
957  return reinterpret_cast<T*>(ret);
958  }
959 
960 #ifdef RLBOX_MEASURE_TRANSITION_TIMES
961  inline std::vector<rlbox_transition_timing>&
962  process_and_get_transition_times()
963  {
964  return transition_times;
965  }
966  inline int64_t get_total_ns_time_in_sandbox_and_transitions()
967  {
968  int64_t ret = 0;
969  for (auto& transition_time : transition_times) {
970  if (transition_time.invoke == rlbox_transition::INVOKE) {
971  ret += transition_time.time;
972  } else {
973  ret -= transition_time.time;
974  }
975  }
976  return ret;
977  }
978  inline void clear_transition_times() { transition_times.clear(); }
979 #endif
980 };

982 #if defined(__clang__)
983 # pragma clang diagnostic push
984 # pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wgnu-zero-variadic-macro-arguments"
985 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
986 // Can't turn off the variadic macro warning emitted from -pedantic so use a
987 // hack to stop GCC emitting warnings for the reminder of this file
988 # pragma GCC system_header
989 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
990 // Doesn't seem to emit the warning
991 #else
992 // Don't know the compiler... just let it go through
993 #endif
994 
1003 #ifdef RLBOX_USE_STATIC_CALLS
1004 
1005 # define sandbox_lookup_symbol_helper(prefix, func_name) prefix(func_name)
1006 
1007 # define invoke_sandbox_function(func_name, ...) \
1008  template INTERNAL_invoke_with_func_ptr<decltype(func_name)>( \
1009  #func_name, \
1010  sandbox_lookup_symbol_helper(RLBOX_USE_STATIC_CALLS(), func_name), \
1011  ##__VA_ARGS__)
1012 
1013 # define get_sandbox_function_address(func_name) \
1014  template INTERNAL_get_sandbox_function_ptr<decltype(func_name)>( \
1015  sandbox_lookup_symbol_helper(RLBOX_USE_STATIC_CALLS(), func_name))
1016 
1017 #else
1018 
1019 # define invoke_sandbox_function(func_name, ...) \
1020  template INTERNAL_invoke_with_func_name<decltype(func_name)>( \
1021  #func_name, ##__VA_ARGS__)
1022 
1023 # define get_sandbox_function_address(func_name) \
1024  template INTERNAL_get_sandbox_function_name<decltype(func_name)>(#func_name)
1025 
1026 #endif
1027 
1028 #define sandbox_invoke(sandbox, func_name, ...) \
1029  (sandbox).invoke_sandbox_function(func_name, ##__VA_ARGS__)
1030 
1031 #define sandbox_function_address(sandbox, func_name) \
1032  (sandbox).get_sandbox_function_address(func_name)
1033 
1034 #if defined(__clang__)
1035 # pragma clang diagnostic pop
1036 #else
1037 #endif
1038 
1039 }
